article.title: 10 Things To Do At Night In Dublin: Capturing Its Very Essence
article.lead_paragraph: A popular European destination for travelers from all across the globe, Dublin is a city with the kind of charm that keeps people falling in love. Poetry, art, history and an active after-hours pub scene are just a few of the amazing qualities that add to the allure of this historic Irish capital. Read on to discover 10 of the best things to do in Dublin at night.
article.proposal:
Capturing the Essence of Dublin: 10 Things to do at Night
 
Lead paragraph

1. Self-guided night stroll
- requires no pre-planning
- Have an ice cream
- Trinity College Campus, Howth, and walking along the bridges of the River Liffey are all good routes

2. Attend a Night Mass
- Evening chorus music
- Christ Church Cathedral
- Saint Patrick's Cathedral

3. Kayaking Tour
- City Kayaking Dublin - safe double seaters with changing rooms on facility

4. Haunted Tour
- Hidden Dublin Walks
- Northside Ghost Walk
- Hellfire Club Tour - 3 hours

5. Sporting Events
- Experience Gaelic Games - Irish football game at night
- Greyhound racing at Shelbourne Park

6. Irish Film Institute
- Culturate institute showcasing Irish, independent, and international cinema
- Temple Bar
- Festivals and Events

7. Theatre
- Grand Canal Theatre
- Abbey Theatre

8. Visit a distillery
- Better understand the origin of Dublin's drinking culture
- Old Jameson Bow Street Distillery
- Guinness Storehouse

9. Local Pub Crawl
- Temple Bar
- Guinness Storehouse Rooftop Bar
- Doheny & Nesbitt 

10. VIP Treatment
- The Pink - Elite nightclub where many celebrities hang out
- Johnnie Fox's pub located in the Dublin Mountains. Four course meal and live Irish music and dance performances

Summary Paragraph
article.meta_description: Uncover endless possibilities for adventure and discovery with this top 10 list of things to do in Dublin at night, including night tours, pub crawls, and unforgettable performances.

snippets.title: 1. Self-guided night stroll
snippets.description:
If you’re open to a quiet evening of reflection and meditation, a nighttime stroll through the streets of Dublin may be just the thing you need. Wander along the romantic bridges of the River Liffey, passing by the tranquil campus of Trinity College, and cap the night off with an ice cream or decadent dessert. Word to the wise: convenient hop-on, hop-off city tours make it easy to visit popular tourist attractions while saving you time and much-needed energy.

> #### 24-Hour Hop-on, Hop-off Tour
>
> **Price**: from 26 USD
>
> **Opening Hours**:  Open 24/7
>
> **Access**: Departs from Dublin's City Centre
>
> **Near by Food**:  Gino's Gelato, 34B Grafton Street, Dublin 2, Ireland
>
> **Website**: [Book Now](https://www.viator.com/tours/Dublin/24-Hour-Hop-on-Hop-off-3-Routes-and-Dublin-Twilight-Combination-Bus-Tour/d503-3703P32)

snippets.title: 2. Evening devotion
snippets.description:
While it may not be the first idea that comes to mind, attending an evening devotion at one of Dublin’s many churches can be a uniquely enriching experience for many. The Saint Patrick’s Cathedral often accepts visitors as late as 7 or 8pm, with its choral evensong beginning at 5:30pm most nights. It is occasionally accompanied by the lovely musical notes of a reverent and harmonious orchestral chorus. The [Christ Church Cathedral](https://trip101.com/article/christ-church-cathedral-the-most-iconic-and-visited-church-in-dublin) also prides itself on its musical scores and even has a choir of all female choristers. Both churches are open for worship and guided tours. 

> #### St. Patrick's Cathedral - Dublin
>
> **Address**:  St. Patrick's Close, Wood Quay, Dublin 8, Ireland
>
> **Access**: 11 minute walk from Dublin Castle
>
> **Contact**:  +353 14539472; info@stpatrickscathedral.ie
>
> **Website**: [More Info](https://www.stpatrickscathedral.ie/)

snippets.title: 3. Kayaking tour
snippets.description:
A splendid kayaking tour of the city’s canals is a spectacular use of a traveler’s curiosity and adventurous spirit. With departures lasting well into the late evening hours, the tour includes a safety jacket and instructional pre-departure briefing. Meanwhile, certified guides are more than happy to recount the histories of important landmarks in the area as you glide comfortably along the River Liffey.

> #### 2-Hour Liffey River Kayaking Adventure
>
> **Price**: from 31 USD
>
> **Opening Hours**:  Hourly departures from 9am - 8pm. 
>
> **Duration**:  around 2 hours 
>
> **Website**: [Book Now](https://www.viator.com/tours/Dublin/City-River-Trip/d503-29083P1/important-info)

snippets.title: 4. Haunted night tours
snippets.description:
If you’re a sucker for all things eerie and unsettling then you won’t want to miss the city’s extensive selection of haunted ghost walks, cemetery resurrections, and night tours. Be sure to uncover the dark mystery of Dublin as knowledgeable guides take you back in time through a complex look at its sordid past. Notable destinations include the Bully’s Acre Cemetery, Kilmainham Gaol, and the Dublin Castle. 

> #### Dublin Gravedigger Ghost Tour
>
> **Price**: from 27 USD
>
> **Duration**:  around 3 hours 
>
> **Access**: Departs from College Green
>
> **Website**: [Book Now](https://www.viator.com/tours/Dublin/Dublin-Gravedigger-Ghost-Tour/d503-5299GRAVE/important-info)

snippets.title: 5. Greyhound racing
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BWOITmVliKF/?tagged=shelbourneparkstadium

A mere 15 minute walk from the city center, the Shelbourne Park Stadium is home to some of the most exciting greyhound races in the city. A new shuttle service from Burgh Quay departs at seven o’clock on race nights, just in time for the 8pm spectacle. If you’re feeling lucky, you may even consider partaking in some good-natured betting of your own. 

> #### Shelbourne Park Greyhound Stadium
>
> **Address**:  South Lotts Road, Dublin 4, Ireland
>
> **Opening Hours**:  6:30pm on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Fridays; 6pm on Saturdays
>
> **Contact**:  +353 1890269969
>
> **Website**: [More info](http://www.igb.ie/go-greyhound-racing/our-stadiums/shelbourne-park-greyhound-stadium/)

snippets.title: 6. Irish Film Institute
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BCAjWgEkzVM/

Incredibly moving documentaries, international works, and independent movies help fuel the artistic underbelly of Ireland’s national film institute. Located in Dublin’s hip Temple Bar area, IFI aims to educate and engage its viewers by showcasing some of the finest cinematic talent of the past and present. In addition to guided discussions and other events, it also features an on-site cafe and gift shop.

> #### Irish Film Institute
>
> **Address**:  6 Eustace St., Temple Bar, Dublin 2, Ireland
>
> **Contact**:  +353 16795744; info@irishfilm.ie
>
> **Website**: [Learn More](http://www.ifi.ie)

snippets.title: 7. Theatre
snippets.description:
The theatre holds a very special place in the heart of Dubliners as one of many places in the city where literature, poetry, and visual performance all come together in a spectacular display of artistic creativity. The Bord Gais Energy Theatre of Grand Canal is one of the city’s most popular performing arts theaters, exhibiting award-winning plays, shows, concerts, and musicals. Other notable performance venues include the nearby Abbey Theatre and National Concert Hall. 

> #### Bord Gais Energy Theatre
>
> **Address**:  Grand Canal Quay, Grand Canal Dock, Dublin 2, Co. Dublin, Ireland
>
> **Contact**:  +353 16777999
>
> **Website**: [Explore Shows](http://bordgaisenergytheatre.ie)

images.caption: Bord Gais Energy Theatre - Dublin Grand Canal

snippets.title: 8. Visit a distillery
snippets.description:
Ever notice how a lot of Ireland’s tourism and nightlife centers around the common theme of alcohol? There’s a reason for that. Head over to the nearest distillery to get a better understanding of the origins of its long-held drinking culture as well as an in-depth explanation of how to make such potent night elixirs such as Irish whiskey. Both the [Guinness Storehouse](https://trip101.com/article/guinness-storehouse-have-a-drink-in-dublin) and the Old Jameson Bow Street Distillery are located in the heart of the city.

> #### Old Jameson Distillery
>
> **Address**: Bow St., Smithfield Village, Dublin 7, Ireland 
>
> **Opening Hours**:  9am - 7pm, Monday - Saturday; 10am - 7pm, Sunday
>
> **Contact**:  +353 18072355; bowst@amesonwhiskey.com
>
> **Website**: [Old Jameson Distillery](https://www.jamesonwhiskey.com/ie/tours/oldjamesondistillery)

snippets.title: 9. Local pub crawl
snippets.description:
No trip to Dublin is complete without a tour of the city’s finest pubs. Start your journey on the rooftop bar of the Guinness Storehouse, where you are met with a breathtaking view of the Dublin City skyline wherever you turn. Next, the Temple Bar is the Irish pub excellence. Pop over for a sample of delicious craft beers and authentic selections of the local scotch and bourbons. As an added bonus, live Irish music is played daily around 8pm.  

> #### Temple Bar Pub
>
> **Access**: 6 min walk to Trinity College
>
> **Contact**:  +353 16725286/7; thetemplebar18@gmail.com
>
> **Website**: [Temple Bar Pub](http://www.thetemplebarpub.com/)

images.caption: Temple Bar Celebration in the Streets of Dublin

snippets.title: 10. Get the VIP treatment
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BRiOGQYl6Ba/

Widely known as the highest pub in all of Ireland, Johnnie Fox’s is a traditional Irish pub set on top of the Dublin Mountains. Although live music plays daily here, Fox’s infamous Hooley Night is the star of the show. A splendid 4-course meal precedes delicious evening performances of Irish folk ballads, a traditional dance show, and live bands. Plus, not only do independent shuttles offer nightly services, but children as young as 6 are also welcome to join in on the excitement!

> #### Johnnie Fox's Pub
>
> **Address**:  Glencullen, Co. Dublin, Ireland
>
> **Opening Hours**:  11am - 11:30pm, Monday - Thursday; 11am - 12:30am, Friday - Saturday; 12 - 11pm, Sunday
>
> **Access**: Bus Route 44B; Private Shuttle Service
>
> **Contact**:  +353 12955647
>
> **Website**: [Reservations](https://www.jfp.ie/)

snippets.title: From 0 to 100 in Dublin
snippets.description: Do you enjoy laid-back, moonlit explorations of the city or sophisticated encounters of the artsy, bohemian nature? How about a stiff drink followed by a late night of wild, drunken debauchery? No matter what your preferred travel persona is, Dublin has a multitude of great nighttime activities for your pleasure. Start filling your bucket list today!

article.keyword: best things to do in dublin at night

lead_paragraph_embed.value: A popular European destination for travelers from all across the globe, Dublin is a city with the kind of charm that keeps people falling in love. Poetry, art, history and an active after-hours pub scene are just a few of the amazing qualities that add to the allure of this historic Irish capital. Read on to discover 10 of the best things to do in Dublin at night.

article.guidelines:
##### 1. For listings WITH partner links (getyourguide / viator / klook): 

Category: Things to do 

Tags: things to do

Paragraph Headings: 

- Create a creative and catchy heading for the activity. 

- Example: "North-end Boston secret food tour" should be changed to something like "Indulge in some delicious local fare".

Photos: Not required*

Snippets: Not required*

*Ensure the tour link is copy/pasted in the partner link field for each section


##### 2. For listings WITHOUT partner links:

Category: Things to do 

Tags: things to do

Paragraph Headings: 

- Create a creative and catchy heading for the activity. 

- Example: "North-end Boston secret food tour" should be changed to something like "Indulge in some delicious local fare".

Photos: 
- Include relevant royalty-free / social media photos

- Upload 1 relevant royalty-free image (non-social media image) in the conclusion paragraph to use as the article's main image (ONLY if all listings have social media images)

- Refer to this tutorial guide: http://bit.ly/imagetutorialguide

Snippets: 

- Insert the "Things to do / Tours / Attractions" snippet manually at the end of each listing's paragraph and edit the information accordingly.

navigator.introduction:
Brittany is an avid travel enthusiast with a love for foreign languages and an insatiable curiosity about the world. A bit of a TV junkie, she replenishes lost brain cells by curling up with her favorite language learning apps at night.

Brittany also enjoys doing yoga to calm her scattered mind and cooking up clever new schemes to keep herself alive while funding her travels.
